sect1.title: Nephthys
sect1.para: Nephthys is an administration tool for file sharing with common file transfer methods like WebDAV and FTP.

To be more specific, Nephthys provides a web interface for handling file sharing slots (so called 'buckets') and the necessary directory structure on the server. Nephthys it self does not provide any functionallity for WebDAV or FTP - it relys on well known projects like Apache, proftpd, ... .
The interface has been designed to be simple and easy to handle so that everybody can use it to share files.

sect1.title: How does Nephthys its job?
sect1.para: Via the Nephthys web interface a user can create buckets. These buckets stand for directories in the webserver's file system. Each of the buckets has a corresponding directory in the filesystem which get identified by a SHA1-hash.

The idea behind is, that no authentication for the access protocol (WebDAV, FTP, ...) is necessary. Instead the access protocol only needs to ensure, that no directory-listing is possible in the root directory. Otherwise it would be possible to find out which buckets are there. Because of the SHA1-named, 40 characters long directory names, it is difficult to locate them without the possibility of directory-listing.
